Chapter 3 Statistical Charts 3.1 2D Histograms A 2D histogram is a visualization of a bivariate distribution. And it looks like a heat map. # library(plotly) s <- matrix(c(1, -.75, -.75, 1), ncol = 2) obs <- mvtnorm::rmvnorm(500, sigma = s) fig <- plot_ly(data = mtcars, x = ~hp, y= ~mpg) fig2 <- subplot( fig %>% add_markers(alpha = 0.2), fig %>% add_histogram2d() ) fig2 3.2 Box Plot 3.2.1 Basic Boxplot library(plotly) fig <- plot_ly(data = mtcars, y= ~mpg, type = "box") fig 3.2.2 Horizontal Boxplot library(plotly) fig <- plot_ly(data = mtcars, x= ~mpg, type = "box") fig 3.2.3 Adding Jittered Points library(plotly) fig <- plot_ly(data = mtcars, y= ~mpg, type = "box", boxpoints = "all", jitter = 0.3) fig 3.2.4 Several Box Plots fig <- plot_ly(data = mtcars, y= ~mpg, color = ~as.factor(cyl), type = "box") fig 3.3 Histograms 3.3.1 Basic Histograms library(plotly) fig <- plot_ly(data = mtcars, x = ~hp, type = "histogram", nbinsx = 15) fig 3.3.2 Stacked Histogram fig <- plot_ly(data = mtcars, x = ~hp, type = "histogram", cumulative = list(enabled=TRUE), nbinsx = 15) fig 3.4 Violin Plots fig <- mtcars %>% plot_ly( y = ~hp, type = 'violin', box = list( visible = T ), meanline = list( visible = T ), x0 = 'Horse Power' ) fig <- fig %>% layout( yaxis = list( title = "", zeroline = F ) ) fig
